criteria.name: Research & Development Investment
criteria.description: Amount of capital invested in R&D to drive innovation and product development.
criteria.reason: High R&D investment often correlates with a robust pipeline of new therapies and innovations.

data_points.name: Annual R&D Expenditure
data_points.description: Total spending on research activities annually.

data_points.name: Percentage of Revenue Spent on R&D
data_points.description: The ratio of R&D spending to total revenue.

key_points: Higher R&D can lead to more innovative products.
R&D costs often fluctuate based on clinical trials.
Market trends can drive R&D focus areas.

charts.usage: Visualizes the comparison of R&D investments across companies.

criteria.name: Regulatory Approval Rates
criteria.description: Percentage of therapies that receive regulatory approval after clinical trials.
criteria.reason: Higher approval rates indicate better pipeline robustness and strategic execution.

data_points.name: New Drug Application (NDA) Approval Rate
data_points.description: Percentage of submitted NDAs that get approved.

data_points.name: Clinical Trial Success Rate
data_points.description: Percentage of clinical trials that progress to the next phase.

key_points: Regulatory challenges can delay product launches.
Investments in regulatory consultancy enhance success.

charts.usage: Displays the proportion of approved versus rejected applications.

criteria.name: Market Penetration Rate
criteria.description: The extent to which a biotechnology product captures the total market potential.
criteria.reason: Indicates the competitive edge and product acceptance in the market.

data_points.name: Market Share of Innovation
data_points.description: Percentage of the market held by a specific product.

data_points.name: Growth Rate in Relevant Market
data_points.description: Year-over-year growth of the biotechnology market.

normalized_data_points.name: Market Penetration Percentage
normalized_data_points.formula: Total Sales of Product / Total Market Size

key_points: Competitor actions can rapidly shift market dynamics.
Regulatory changes can open or close markets.
Revenue growth provides insights into penetration effectiveness.

charts.usage: Illustrates the trend of market share over time.

criteria.name: Partnership and Collaboration Networks
criteria.description: The extent and effectiveness of partnerships between biotech and other sectors such as pharma, academic institutions, and CROs.
criteria.reason: Collaborations can enhance innovation and reduce costs through shared resources.

data_points.name: Number of Strategic Partnerships
data_points.description: Total collaborations established within a timeframe.

data_points.name: Success Rate of Collaborations
data_points.description: Percentage of collaborations leading to successful product development.

key_points: Geopolitical factors can influence collaborative efforts.
Diverse partnerships can yield innovative outcomes.

charts.usage: Shows the distribution of successful versus unsuccessful collaborations.

criteria.name: Product Pipeline Diversity
criteria.description: Measure of variety within the product development pipeline, covering different therapeutic areas.
criteria.reason: A diversified pipeline mitigates risks associated with reliance on limited products.

data_points.name: Number of Products in Pipeline
data_points.description: Total count of products under development.

data_points.name: Therapeutic Areas Represented
data_points.description: Diversity of therapeutic categories within the pipeline.

normalized_data_points.name: Pipeline Diversity Index
normalized_data_points.formula: Number of Unique Therapeutic Areas / Total Products

key_points: Focus areas should align with unmet medical needs.
Investment trends can guide pipeline focus.

charts.usage: Represents the number of products against therapeutic diversity levels.

criteria.name: Intellectual Property Strength
criteria.description: The robustness of patents related to products in development, influencing competitive advantage.
criteria.reason: Strong IP can provide market exclusivity and protect against competition.

data_points.name: Number of Patents Granted
data_points.description: Total patents awarded in the last five years.

data_points.name: Patent Longevity
data_points.description: Average remaining lifespan of existing patents.

normalized_data_points.name: IP Strength Score
normalized_data_points.formula: Number of Active Patents / Average Patent Lifespan

key_points: Strong IP protects against generic competition.
Litigation risks associated with IP should be assessed.
International IP laws can influence strategy.

charts.usage: Compares the strength of IP across various areas/technologies.

criteria.name: Financial Sustainability
criteria.description: Ability of the company to maintain operations and growth without jeopardizing its financial health.
criteria.reason: Sustainable financial health indicates long-term viability and operational effectiveness.

data_points.name: Cash on Hand
data_points.description: Total liquid assets available for operational expenses.

data_points.name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio
data_points.description: The proportion of company financing from debt versus equity.

key_points: Adequate cash reserves can attract investors.

charts.usage: Displays trends in cash reserves over time.
